cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles south-southwest of Acapulco, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move generally west to west-northwest for the next 2 days, then turn northwest and north, paralleling the southwest Mexican coast and approaching the southern Baja California peninsula late in the 5-day period.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or northern Baja California peninsula (if any landfall occurs)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwestern Mexico from Guerrero to Jalisco and the Baja California peninsula coastline
weather_observation.wind: Minimal tropical-storm-force winds are expected at Long Beach; gusts may reach 20â€“30 mph late week if the system tracks farther north.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Kay could bring scattered showers and brief heavy downpours (<2 inches) to Southern California late week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Southern California beaches beginning late week.
